page.title: 12Lune Estuary
page.content: There are two tides a day. Westerly winds combined with high tides can cause flooding, usually between October and March. There have been two such storms in l977 and l983. On llth November l977, the land was flooded to Briggs Brow, Thurnham, when the river banks burst at Janson's Pool and Bank End. Crook Farm had three windows shattered in spite of shutters; Clarksons Farm was flooded but there was no loss of life. On lst February l983, a tunnel under Cockersand Abbey was exposed when the tide burst the sea wall. It was identified as a sewer.
